description:
The government can no longer ignore the Dire Wraith invasion as the Helicarrier of S.H.I.E.LD. comes under attack. The President of the United States addresses the nations of the globe and now the world knows the truth. And as a certain cigar chomping super-spy bluntly puts it "...now that the talkin's over...the fightin' starts!"Â 
The World leaders decide to getr together and leave old enmities behind to join forces against an common enemy - Dire Wraiths
name: Total War, Part 2: Paranoia Strikes Deep!

description: Black Cat's search for super-powers leads her into the clutch's of the Kingpin -- and it's all for the love of Spidey!
name: Power Search!

description: Luke's mission is to head out to other worlds to ask they join the new planetary council. However, he finds himself on a world that won't suffer his intrusion.
name: Diplomacy

description: The never-before revealed story about what happened to Benjamin J. Grimm after he became the Thing. It's the story that happened between Fantastic Four #1 and #2. If that isn't enough to whet your appetite, wait until you see what new peril awaits when Alicia is released from the hospital! Plus a mysterious disappearance at the end! To top it all off, it's written by John Byrne, penciled by Ron Wilson , and inked by Hilary Barta!
name: Marking Time

description:
A trip to the Massachusetts Academy turns disastrous for Kitty Pryde and Doug Ramsey.

Xavier enjoys his newfound ability to walk by working out. However, he is disrupted again by the mysterious probing force. He is joined by a concerned Storm, who admits her own doubts about her changes. Later, she visits her plants in the botanical gardens and breaks up a robbery in process, hurt that the victims are more scared of her than the thugs. Kitty Pryde, in the meantime, is hanging out with her pal, Doug Ramsey, and confiding the trouble she has with Stormâs change. Doug asks her to accompany him on his visit to the Massachusetts Academy. Back at Xavierâs, Colossus is troubled about Kittyâs friendship with Doug, as it really drives home all the differences between him and Kitty. In the evening, Kitty announces to Xavier and the X-Men that she intends to accompany Doug. As Emma frost is in a coma and Xavier can monitor her telepathically, she should not be in danger. Xavier and Storm agree. Later, Storm sweeps Kitty up high above the mansion and forces her to have their long overdue talk. Storm drives home that, while she and Kitty are friends, it was wrong of both of them to assume that Storm could take Kittyâs motherâs place. She can feel now finally and if Kitty cares for her she will have to accept that. Both of them make up. Later, the X-men drive Kitty to the airport, where she and Doug are led to the Academyâs private Jet. Kittyâs in for a nasty surprise, though, as welcoming them aboard is a very much recovered Emma Frost. Her telepathic scream for help goes unheard, for the X-Men are drawn to the Central Park and to a strange structure. As they enter it, they disappear from Earth.
name: Whose Life Is It, Anyway ?

description: WHAT IFâ¦CAPTAIN AMERICA WERE REVIVED TODAY? The 1950s Cap is revived before Steve Rogers.
name: What if Captain America Were Revived Today?

description: The Entity-possessed Xavier psychically caressed Moonstar's soul, filling her with waves of pleasure and bending her to his will. Meanwhile, the X-Men and Karza, having broken free of the Entity's will and escaped their dungeon, discovered the Entity's dying form, now housing the true Xavier's mind. Xavier revealed the mind-swap b/t Kitty and Karza. Bioship's equipment helped keep the Entity's body alive.
name: Dark Xavier!

deck: Pacific Comics adaptation of the first book in Michael Moorcock's Elric series.
description: Elric, wielding Stormbringer, confronts Yyrkoon.
name: At Last-- Stormbringer!

description:
The third issue of Vanguard Illustrated sports a cover by industry legend Al Williamson and continues its tradition of paring newcomers with established professionals.

Story Titles

  • Freakwave part 3 by Milligan and McCarthy
  • Encyclopedias part 3 "Duel With Dorf Dishware" by Baron and Rude
  • Killer in Orbit by Rex Lindsey
  • Be it What It Will, I'll Go To It Laughing by Campiti and Yeates
The wrap-up! You've waited long enough - and now you're getting it! The full story behind Jack's heritage, and the dramatic climax to the most startling and innovative Limited Series!
name: Heart Attack

description:
The original US reprint series from Eagle Comics reprinting the best Judge Dredd stories from UK anthology comic 2000AD.

Cover: Brian Bolland (Judge Dredd)

  • Cursed Earth (parts 6-10) (progs 66-70) (Pat Mills - Mike McMahon (parts 6-8) and Brian Bolland (parts 9-10))
name: Judge Dredd 6

description:
"Do you believe in Magik?" You will -- when you see Illyana in action! That's right -- this story picks up where the Magik limited series left off, and when Colossus's kid sister battles the evil S'ym, the excitement never lets up! Oh, yeah, the New Mutants are in this issue too!

Illyana Rasputin has returned from Limbo as a young teenager. Yet, despite the snow and joy the New Mutants get out of playing in it, she holds herself apart and contemplates the huge weight on her shoulders. She especially notes the Beatrice Medallion and how it only needs two more marks to become complete. She feels that she canât trust anyone with her secret of being full of so much evil power.

Professor Xavier looks on and is troubled that he hasnât been able to read Illyanaâs mind since she returned from Limbo. The New Mutants see the look of concern on his face and wonder if it isnât due to sadness at his girlfriend Lilandraâs departure from the school. They plan a party to cheer him up and head to town to get supplies. Illyana joins them and they convince Stevie Hunter to drive.

While away, the demon Sâym confronts Xavier. The Professor puts up a weak defense but is easily bested. Sâym then waits for Illyana to return so he can take her back to Belasco, the ruler of Limbo who wants Illyana as his heir.

At Salem Center, the New Mutants are surprised that the mall is still being repaired. (It had been destroyed when Sentinels attacked some time prior.) Cannonball tries to impress Amara with his strength and the teens bump in to some old friends. The team then heads home.

At the school, things seem too quiet. Illyana volunteers to see what the Professor is up to, since he canât read her mind and spoil the party. She stumbles onto Sâym and fails to fight back, as she is too traumatized at seeing the demon that terrorized her in Limbo. She has the resolve, however, to teleport the New Mutant team into the school via Limbo. The boys and Rahne try to fight Sâym one-on-one and fail. Dani steps in and conjures up Sâymâs latent fears â images of Belasco and his hoped-for successor, Illyana as the Darkchylde. Sâym is only briefly scared, but it is enough for Stevie (on her bum knee) to carry Illyana away. Sâym quickly finds them but Illyana comes to and confronts her tormentor with the Soulsword. Sâym trembles and swears allegiance to Illyana. She banishes him to Limbo and then wipes Stevieâs mind, as she doesnât want anyone to know of her power.

That evening, the party for the Professor is in full swing. The X-Men appear and find Stevieâs car and a mountain in the school (all part of the fight with Sâym). They join the party. Illyana is still ill at ease until the Professor stands and asks her to dance. She begins to see that he may have an idea as to her secret magic but treats her the same. She happily accepts the dance.

Outside, Doug Ramsey takes Kitty Pryde aside and tells her that he has been accepted to the Massachusetts Academy. Kitty doesnât know how to tell him how dangerous that could be.
name: Do You Believe In -- Magik ?

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
The fourth issue of Vanguard Illustrated sports a cover by Steve Rude, signalling the finale of Mike Baron and Steve Rude's Encyclopedias story.

Story Titles

  • Quark by Baron and Burchett
  • Encyclopedias part 4 "Success" by Baron and Rude
  • A Tangled Web by Ruth Raymond
  • Low Level Diplomatic Immunity by Neary and Austin
  • Student Filmmaker by Rick Geary

The Young Steelers in "The House That Wouldn't Die" - Steel Sterling's youthful associates embark on a ghostly outing in a rural area of America. April has repeated visions of a family that died twenty years ago in a tragic series of events. Her teammates doubt her eyes until a house thought-lost presents a rescue mission! What is real? What is otherworldly? Witness this dramatic, ethereal ending!

Trapped in the inter-dimensional space between Earth-2 and Earth-X, the Spectre helplessly watches, as the Japanese invade California. The Freedom Fighters, trapped behind an aura provided by the Spectre, bear witness to the Japanese attack, on an oilfield in Goleta. The Spectre's aura protects the Freedom Fighters from immediately being killed by the Japanese. As the aura finally fades away, the Freedom Fighters engage the Japanese military. After repelling the Japanese ground forces, the Freedom Fighters take the fight out into the Pacific Ocean.

The Spectre is barred, by a higher power, from interfering. The Spectre is allowed to bear witness, as events unfold, simultaneously, on Earth-2. The Starman carries the Firebrand, Johnny Quick, and Liberty Belle to Santa Barbara, California. En route, Johnny Quick bickers with Liberty Belle. Liberty Belle reveals that their contact, in Santa Barbara, is a man she has romantic feelings for, Captain Rick Cannon. At the rendezvous point, in Goleta, the All-Star Squadron find signs of a struggle. The All-Star Squadron splits up, into two teams of two, to investigate Cannon's disappearance.

The Firebrand reveals, to Johnny Quick, her newfound ability to fly. The Firebrand, and Johnny Quick, investigate a houseboat, adrift near the refinery. Neptune Perkins confronts the Firebrand, and Johnny Quick. Spying a periscope breaking the ocean's surface, the Firebrand, Johnny Quick, and Neptune Perkins investigate. Liberty Belle, and the Starman, follow Cannon's trail to a warehouse, in the Japanese section of Santa Barbara. There, they find a group of Issei, and Nisei, citizens meeting with a shadowy figure.

None of the assembled Issei, nor Nisei, have any interest in switching their loyalty to Imperial Japan. The shadowy figure reveals herself to be Tsunami. The Issei, and Nisei, refuse Tsunami's recruitment drive. Cannon orders them to take Tsunami into custody. Tsunami attacks Cannon. Liberty Belle sends a signal, to Tom Revere, to ring the Liberty Bell, in Philadelphia. The ringing of the LIberty Bell enhances Liberty Belle's physical prowess. Liberty Belle, and the Starman, storm the warehouse. The Starman rescues Cannon, while LIberty Belle engages Tsunami.

The Starman is disarmed, giving the advantage to Tsunami. An elderly man leaps in the way of Tsunami's attack. Horrified at her actions, Tsunami flees. The elderly man reveals that Tsunami is his daughter. The Spectre attempts to return to Earth-2. In doing so, he inadvertently draws Earth-X towards Earth-2's dimensional space. The Specte fights to keep the two worlds from colliding. The Freedom Fighters attack the Japanese fleet. Baron Blitzkrieg orders the Freedom Fighters to surrender, or else he will give the order to execute the Hour Man.
name: The Battle of Santa Barbara--Times Two!

description: See below: Cover Original Art by Ron Randell and Rick Maygar.
name: To Your Sky-Born Father Go!
Wilderness

description:
Catman escapes jail again with the intention of stealing a statue of the Egyptian cat goddess Bast.

Two man are locked up in the same cell, one known as Collins and the other Blake, who is Cat-Man. After a time of self induced catanoia, Blake wagers with Collins over defeating Batman and winning Collins hidden loot, or having to hand over the Cat-Man suit.

What ensues is a cat and bat game through Gotham museum. Robin (Jason Todd) is neturalized and less then effective in helping. With Batman disoriented with the sounds of the Cat-Man, he fights for his life.

In the end, there is more then one Cat, and the Batman costum is worse for wear.
name: Nine Cradles of Death

description:
Black Lightning awakens to find himself immersed in water and learns the true reason why he was taken by the Masters of Disaster.

The Outsiders rescue Black Lightning from the Masters of Disaster before he is killed. Black Lightning also comes to terms with some of his inner demons.
name: The Execution of Black Lightning

description: Various team ups with Superman
name: Superman Team Up Action

description:
Superman travels back in time to World War II to find out about a story that a young Perry White wrote, while a war correspondent, about Hitler's Secret Olympics in "Back to World War II."

Perry White is given an award for an article he wrote during WWII. The problem is, he doesn't remember writing it. Join Superman has he travels back to WWII to follow Perry White around and find out why he doesn't remember. As Blackhawk tries to stop Hitler from proving the Arian Race is superior to England's greatest athletes.
name: Back to World War II

description:
A trio of vandals break into the Flash Museum. Their first order of business is to destroy the statue of the Flash. Dexter Myles, the curator, attempts to stop them, taking a chunk of debris to the head for his trouble. With Myles lying unconscious, the vandals set fire to the Flash Museum. Police officers rescue Myles, then contact the fire department. The Flash meets with his new defense attorney, Cecile Horton. The Flash takes Horton to see her law partner, Peter Farley, in the hospital. Farley's condition is much improved.

Word of the fire at the Flash Museum reaches the Flash. After checking on Myles, the Flash aids the fire department in quelling the blaze. Despite their best efforts, the damage to the Flash Museum is considerable.The three vandals report to the Pied Piper. After removing micro-sonic devices from their ears, the Pied Piper sends them on their way, with no memory of their past actions. A getaway car drives off a bridge, landing upside down in the mud.

Before officers can mount rescue efforts, the Flash intervenes, moving the car up onto the shore. Mace brings his deranged sidekick, Spike, to the Woodside Psychiatric Clinic. Fiona Webb, having suffered a total emotional breakdown, has made great progress in her recovery. Mace forces his way in. Holding the therapist at gun point, Mace forces him to treat Spike. In his delusional state, Spike attacks Webb, believing her to be his mother. The Flash intervenes, immediately taking down Spike, before he turns his attention to Mace.

With nothing to lose, Mace fires on Webb. The Flash deflects the bullets, then beats down Mace. After tending to the therapist, the Flash checks on Webb. World famous trial lawyer, N.D. Redik, encounters Horton, on the courthouse steps. Redik is displeased to learn that Horton is representing the Flash, in the Scarlet Speedster's upcoming trial for manslaughter. The Flash spirits Horton away. Before their relationship progress too far, Horton informs the Flash that she despises him, and is only representing him in deference to her partner, Farley.
name: Down With the Flash!

description:
Firestorm saves tourists on the Staten Island Ferry when a freight train plunges off a railroad drawbridge. Felicity Smoak is very angry with Firestorm over the method he used to lift the train back onto the tracks. Cliff Carmichael causes mayhem at the rehearsal of the school play. Ronnie talks with Blythe and 'Bug' Banner, whose father is leading the school play. Reporter Roxanne Sharpe confronts Lorraine Reilly. Firehawk is ambushed by an aerial drone. Byte and Firestorm battle at a computer show.

Firestorm826's Panel-by-Panel Story Summary (Spoiler Alert)

Two men, physicist Martin Stein and teenage jock Ronnie Raymond, transformed by a bizarre nuclear accident into a composite being - - and now, when they fuse, they share - - the Fury of Firestorm, the Nuclear Man!

Morning, over Manhattan, on a brisk late February Sunday, when a young manâs fancy turns toâ¦ âA career?â asks Stein, surprised, âThis may sound patronizing, Ronald, but arenât you still a little young to worry about your future vocation?â Firestorm banks and dives around the trestles of a raised railroad drawbridge above a crowded sight-seeing ferry cruising along the Hudson River. âHigh school wonât last forever, Professor,â Ronnie replies, âThese days a guyâs got to be prepared. Itâs a dog-eat-dog world out there. How do you feel about certified public accounting?â Firestorm swoops low near the ferry as an onlooker films him with a camcorder. âTerribly. Youâre joking of course,â Stein hopes, adding, âRonald, at your age, you should enjoy yourself - - take a Circle Line cruise around Manhattan Island, like those people - - go on dates withâ¦Aha. Youâre feeling guilty about your girlfriend, Doreenâ¦and this concern about a career is your way of shutting out your true feelings.â Ronnie asks to be spared the psychoanalysis, saying, âJust âcause we sometimes share a brain doesnât mean you canâ¦â HONNNK! HONNNNK!

KRASH! Suddenly, a speeding freight train crashes through the gate at the drawbridge! âUh-oh!â Ronnie yells in surprise. The train rockets up the raised drawbridge! HONNNK! Just below the bridge is the crowded ferry! âProfessor Stein, that freight train - - itâs running wild! And if it goes off that bridgeâ¦!â Ronnie exclaims. Stein quickly directs his attention nearby. âBehind us, Ronald, that auto junkyard we flew over - - with our atomic restructuring powers, we can alter the molecular structure of those salvaged cars, create an enormous magnet!â FZAM! Ronnie uses a transforming atomic burst to create a giant magnet, quickly guiding it into position above the now-plunging train! âAs a Dr. Joyce Brothers, youâre a bust, Professor,â Ronnie comments, âbut in the Bright Idea Department, youâve got the goods!â Ronnie energizes the giant flying magnet. It catches the falling train just in time! He guides the train safely back onto the bridge. âPret-ty neat!â he smiles.

Firestorm pirouettes down in a spiffy spiral just off to the side of the ferry. The crowd of tourists cheers and applauds their rescuer. âDaddy, lookit the man. His headâs burning. Why is his head burning?â a young boy perched on his fatherâs shoulders asks. âUhh, Daddy doesnât know, sweetheart,â the perplexed man answers. âTa-da!â Ronnie announces to the crowd, soaking up their appreciations, but then Stein draws his attention back to more pressing matters. âIf youâre quite finished taking bows, Ronald,â he suggests, âwe should see if the crew of that train needs any additional help.â

Ronnie flies back up to the train on the drawbridge. A woman stands by a train car and he lands next to her. âSave the applause, thanks,â he tells her, âIâm trying to kick the habit.â She looks annoyed. âYou are, hey? I hope youâve got good insurance coverage, buster,â she gripes, âTake a lookâ¦five carloads of computer chips and software disks. Thanks to your incompetence, theyâre ruined.â Firestorm faces her, hands out in wonder. âHold on,â he replies, âYou were going to crash, remember? I saved you guys!â The woman scowls. âSome save. You magnetized my software. That cute trick will cost my company eight million dollars,â she grumps, âIâm going to sue your butt, buster. Get a good lawyer - - youâll need her.â

Ronnie looks shocked at her unexpected accusation. âWait a second, come onâ¦Youâre not serious. How can you sue me? But, ladyâ¦â he asks. âEver hear of malpractice, flame-brain? Read some newspapers,â she says, pointing with disgust at her cargo, âThe nameâs Felicity Smoak. Write it down. Youâll be hearing from me. Now do us both a favor, okay? Get out of here before you âsaveâ something else.â

In a burst of an atomic ring, Firestorm takes flight, leaving Felicity Smoak far below. âRonaldâ¦ahâ¦â Stein starts. âDonât say it,â Ronnie cuts him off. They fly a short ways, landing on the torch of the Statue of Liberty. âAfter all, son, it was my ideaâ¦â Stein says, trying to console Ronnie. âThink that makes me feel better?â he asks, âBetween you and me, Professor Stein, super-heroing doesnât live up to its rep. In factâ¦ever since I became Firestorm, my lifeâs been a botch.â He sits pondering, chin propped up on his hand. âThe one good thing thatâs happened - - meeting Lorraine Reilly, and her becoming Firehawk - - just makes me feel lousy about the way Iâm treating Doreen,â he worries, âWhat I need is a vacation - - from life.â Stein agrees, âSo do we all, my boy, sometimesâ¦â

Monday afternoon, at Bradley Highâ¦ âI feel like a jackass,â Ronnie says, embarrassed, âThe next time I let you talk me into something like this, Doreen, promise youâll talk me out of it.â The class is preparing for the school play and Ronnie is wearing a full knightâs regalia, complete with chainmail coif. âAw, Ronnie, you look cute,â giggles Doreen. Ronnie struggles in the bulky armor, complaining about an itch he canât scratch. âAnd if I even think about sitting down again, I know Iâll never get up,â he complains, âPlease, Lord, donât let the guys on the team see me like this.â Doreen explains that acting in the school play will be just as much fun as playing basketball. âBesides,â she compliments, âyou make a terrific Horatio.â Ronnie is unconvinced, saying, âYeah - - but why did Mr. Bonner have to cast Cliff there as Hamlet?â Doreen adjusts her costumeâs crown and wonders if Ronnie might just be a little jealous.

Mr. Bonner calls the troupe to attention. âCast and crew, everyone - - gather around,â he announces, âIâve got some general notes to go over before we start the dress rehearsal. Ronnie, have you seen my daughter, Blythe?â Ronnie replies that Blythe was just there a moment ago and Doreen explains that Blythe is on the phone in the womanâs room. âShould I get her?â asks Doreen, and Mr. Bonner sends her to find Blythe.

Cliff sees an opportunity to cause his usual mayhem. âNowâs my chance to gum things up for Raymond while Doreenâs out of the way,â he schemes in thought, âHe made a sucker out of meâ¦made me feel sorry for him, when I thought his Dad was dead. From now on, no more Mr. Nice Guy!â Cliff chews up some bubblegum. He takes the squishy, sticky piece of gum and sneaks it onto the floor near Ronnie. Blythe and Doreen return to the stage, and Mr. Bonner starts the dress rehearsal.

âRight. Now that weâre all hereâ¦Let me say how proud I am of the work youâre doing,â he says, ââHamletâ isnât an easy play - - thatâs an understatement - - but youâve tackled it with energy and enthusiasm, and Iâm sure The Bard would approve. Now to specifics: Blythe, play Cordelia as a gentle, wounded childâ¦Cliff, remember Hamletâs long friendship with Horationâ¦Doreen, let Gertrude show more love for her son, and more dismayâ¦Ronnie, ahhâ¦remember Hamlet is your friend. Donât glare at him. All right, places for a run-through.â

Ronnie moves to his mark on the stage. âDonât glare, huh?â he thinks, âIf Mr. Bonner could hear the wisecracks Cliff keeps whispering during my scenes, heâdâ¦whups!â Ronnieâs armored boot sticks on Cliffâs bubblegum and he trips! KLANK! With a loud, metallic rattle, Ronnie falls face-first to the stage! âUnnng!â he groans. âRaymond!â Mr. Bonner chides, âWill you please stop clowning? This isnât the âThree Stooges!ââ Ronnie sits up and looks at his boot, finding the bubblegum. He casts a suspicious sideways glance at Cliff, remembering that his arch-rival was just chewing gum a few moments ago. âCarmichael, you creep,â he says softly. âTemper, Horatio,â Cliff taunts, âRemember, weâre buddies. Bozo.â

Cliff steps over to talk to Blythe. âYour Dad really blew it when he cast Raymond, Blythe,â he tells her, âSay, why donât you and I practice our lines together, laterâ¦?â Blythe turns down the offer, explaining that she needs to help her brother with a science project. She turns to walk away, telling him, âBesides, Cliff, being around you gives me hives.â Cliff scowls, arms across his chest. Ronnie is amused at Blytheâs comment. âStrike three and youâre out, Cliff,â he whispers. âSack it, meat-mind,â Cliff snips back in reply.

Slights, like unwashed wounds, tend to fester, and so, three days later, outside the school cafeteriaâ¦ âHeads up, Raymond. Here comes a guy who can give you style lessons,â Cliff tells Ronnie, ââBugâ Bonner.â Blytheâs little brother walks up, looking nerdy in large glasses and carrying a huge stack of textbooks. Ronnie warns, âDonât pick on the guy, Cliff. Just âcause his sister wouldnâtâ¦â Cliff cuts Ronnie off and teasingly calls out, âHey, Bug - - those books too heavy for you? Here, let me give you a hand! Ha!â With a shove, he knocks Bug down and his textbooks fall all over the floor. Bug sits up, asking, âGee, Cliff, whyâd y-you do that?â Ronnie bends down to help pick up Bugâs books. âHeâs living up to his reputation as class jerk, Barney,â Ronnie says, pointing to his rival and adding, âIâll see you later, Cliff.â

Bug tries to gather up his books, asking Ronnie if Cliff is angry at him about something. âNot at you, Barney - - your sister,â Ronnie explains, glancing at the books Bug was carrying, Many of them are technical computer books. âBlythe?â Bug asks. âForget it,â Ronnie tells him, âSay, do you really read all this stuff about computers? Computersâ¦Sure, everyoneâs into computers these days. I need a careerâ¦This is perfect. Hey, Barney, how much can a guy earn working on these gadgets?â Bug organizes his books and papers and gets back to his feet. âI - - I really donât know, Ronnie,â he answers, âI guess it depends on what field you choose. Software, programmingâ¦hardware engineering and architectureâ¦I never gave it much thought.â Ronnie remains curious, asking how he could find that out. âUhâ¦Thereâs a computer fair at the Coliseum this weekend,â Bug suggests, âSomeone there might know something.â Ronnie hands over a stack of Bugâs books, asking how he became interested in computers. âComputers are safe. You can understand computers, Ronnie,â he answers, âThey make sense - - not like people. People are so, I donât know, unpredictable, like Cliff. If Cliff were a computer, I could turn him off.â Ronnie agrees, saying he feels the same way sometimes. Bug heads down the hallway, and thanks Ronnie for the help. âSee you at the fair?â he asks. Ronnie scratches his head, thinking that Bug is a little weird and that itâs hard to believe heâs Blytheâs brother. âHuh? Oh, sure. Iâll be there, Barney,â Ronnie answers, thinking, âNice kid, but weird.â

Interlude: On the radar screens in the control tower at Dulles International Airport in Washington, D.C., a blip appears and disappears between âsweepsâ¦â A glance at the outside world reveal the cause - - Firehawk! She speeds along at low altitude on her fiery wings. âI shouldnât have taken a chance on being spotted - - but I wanted to get here before tonightâs new broadcast began,â she thinks, âThereâs someone I have to see as Lorraine Reilly!â She comes to a landing outside the television station. In a secluded area, she transforms from Firehawk to Lorraine Reilly. Moments later, inside, she bumps into reporter Roxanne Sharpe in the stationâs hallway.

âMs. Sharpe, could I talk to you?â she asks, âItâs about my father - - and todayâs action by the Senate Ethics Committee.â Roxanne recognizes Lorraine, answering, âHm? Youâre Senator Reillyâs daughterâ¦Lorraine, isnât it? Does he know youâre here?â Lorraine explains that she is there to ask for Roxanneâs help. âHelp, huh? The Committee recommended the Senate censure your father for selling his vote on the âHewitt Industries Bill.â Iâm sorry about that, I respected Senator Reillyâ¦But thatâs the news, and I have to report it,â Roxanne replies. Lorraine suggests that Roxanne could offer Senator Reillyâs side of the story to let him defend himself. âHoney, this is a TV station, not a courtroom,â Roxanne declines, âHeâll have his chance before the Senate, and Iâll report it whenâ¦â Lorraine cuts her off, annoyed, saying, â - - when they destroy him. And youâll be helping them. Damn you!â Roxanne stands her ground, hands on her hips. âHeâs news, kid,â she says dismissively, âThatâs life.â

Lorraine Reilly runs blindly into the station parking lot, and there, out of sight, transforms herselfâ¦though her anger remainsâ¦and continues to blind her. Firehawk takes to the sky, fuming over Roxanne Sharpeâs lack of cooperation. Behind her, a fighter jet drone moves into a position behind her. It beams an image of her to a darkened room where several seated figures look at her face on a giant view screen monitor in front of them. âIs the subject aware of pursuit?â a shadowed figure asks. Another unseen voice answers, âNo. Weâve kept a robot drone at a distance these past few daysâ¦Until now.â A finger reaches down, pressing an illuminated button on a control panel. âIâll activate the attack program,â the second voice continues, âThis should be instructive.â

BZAM! BZAM! BZAM! BZAM! The drone opens fire with a hail of bullets! âHey!â Firehawk yells out, barely dodging the ambush! âIs he nuts? That pilotâs trying to kill me!â she thinks as she goes into an evasive barrel roll to turn and face her adversary, âWait a second - - What pilot? I just caught a glimpse through the cockpit window - - thereâs nobody flying that thing!â SHOOM! The drone launches an air-to-air missile at her! She dives hard to avoid it! âMaybe itâs an experimental fighter from over at Andrews - - and whoeverâs remote controlling it must think Iâm a menace!â she says, âWell, I am a menace. Iâm mad as hell, and I hate being used for target practice. Any other day, Iâd have shrugged this off. But tonight, Iâm burning. And so are you.â She flies near the drone, raising her arms and wings outstretched over her head. She launches a burst of fiery energy at the drone! It hits and knocks the drone out of control. BFOOOM! The drone crashes into the Potomac River near the Jefferson Memorial!

âHer powers, as you see, are considerable, she controls heat at fusion-energy intensity,â the second shadowy voice observes from the darkened room, âbut, as yet, cannot control her emotions. She will be a perfect tool for the 2000 Committee.â The female figure of the voice strides up to the giant monitor screen, looking for a moment at Firehawkâs image, then turns and asks, âMeeting adjourned?â

Saturday: From time to time, the Coliseum at Columbus Circle in Manhattan has hosted auto shows and circuses, dog shows, consumer fairs, and meetings of the A.M.A. This weekendâs National Computer and Peripherals Industry Show promises to be just another industrial seminar. But promises, they say, are made to be broken.

Ronnie walks along on the show floor, looking around at the vast displays of computers, robots, and other high-tech devices. âTerrific. I just got here, and I already feel inferior,â Ronnie worries, âMaybe I should plan a career in TV sports announcing.â He walks up to a large robot. âGreetings, may I be of assistance? What is your area of interest, please?â its electronic voice crackles at Ronnie. âBeats me, big fella,â Ronnie answers, âGot anything for a science dropout?â The robot analyzes Ronnieâs response, and directs him to the video game exhibit in Section 12. âYea, sounds about my speed,â Ronnie answers. He looks nearby and sees a familiar face standing with a woman. âProfessor Stein! I didnât know youâd be here!â Stein greets him, wondering if Ronnie is still trying to find a career.

âUhâ¦sorta,â Ronnie answers sheepishly. He walks over and shakes hands with Stein. The Professor introduces the person he is with. âBelle, meet a young friend of mine - - Ronnie Raymond,â Stein says, âRonald, Belle Haney. We studied together at Stamford, and now it appears we both work for Concordance Research. Belle has a booth here today.â Ronnie and Belle shake hands. âA booth - - ?â Ronnie asks curiously. Belle points down the exhibition floor. âComputer Enhancement of Infrared Imaging Systems. Itâs a Concordance project,â she explains, âOver in Section 12, next to the video games.â

Harry Carew, Steinâs co-worker, strolls up to greet them. âMartin, Martin - - is this any way to treat your coach and friend?â Carew asks. He takes Belleâs hand and chivalrously kisses it. âHere you are, visiting with a lovely lady, and you donât even introduce me,â Carew says. Belle pulls back a bit on her hand, looking slightly annoyed by Carewâs overzealousness. âSigh. Belle, another friend,â Stein offers, âHarry Carew. Harryâs with Concordance, too, in Audio Research.â Belle comments about how Stein has so many friends. âYou were never this social at Stamford,â she notices. âJust fortunate, I suppose,â Stein replies.

While the three Concordance associates confer, Ronnie looks around. âMiss Haney sure seems familiar. Funny, though - - I donât think I ever met her before,â he thinks, âEh? Thereâs Blythe Bonner - - sheâs going somewhere in a hurry. Guess she didnât see me - - but whereâs her brother, Barney? He talked me into this thing. Aw, whoâm I kidding - - ?â Ronnie gives up on the pursuit of high-tech information and walks over to the video game section. âComing here was my idea,â he thinks, âand it was a bust. Only computer I can handle is a video game.â Ronnie busies himself on a Mac-Man machine. Boop! Boop! Boop! His Mac-Man gobbles up Mac-Dots untilâ¦BLAP! It gets gobbled up! âAnd Iâm not too hot at that,â Ronnie sighs, âI might as well pack it in andâ¦â

âEEEEEEE!â a voice suddenly cries out nearby! The giant robot that greeted Ronnie has gone berserk! It has grabbed Belle in its arms! WHIRRR! WHIRR! It moves her rapidly up and down in its tight grip. âOh, my God!â Belle screams, âItâs crushing me!â Ronnie looks on in shock, saying, âI donât believe this. Ms. Haney?â Stein quickly calls over to Ronnie. Harry Carew wrestles against one of the robotâs arms. âMustâve blown a circuit or something!â he calls to Belle as he struggles with the arm, âHang on, Belle, Iâll have you loose in aâ¦unnnghhhhâ¦hernia.â

Ronnie and Stein sprint to find a sheltered spot. âHurry, weâve got to fuse,â Stein says, âBehind this display!â Ronnie starts to ask, âThat robot - - is it really trying toâ¦?â FZAAAAM! Firestorm appears! âKill her?â Stein finishes, âYou have eyes, Ronald! That robot may have been designed as a harmless directory - - but someoneâs reprogrammed it as a mechanical mauler!â Firestorm flies next to the rogue robot. FZOT! He aims a nuclear burst at it. No effect! âUh, Professor - - my powers arenât working against it!â Ronnie yells. âNot working?â Stein answers, âThat isnât possible!â The burst knocked Harry Carew over. He sits up, saying, âFirestorm? Back up, kid - - let me try again!â SPAK! The robot swings an arm out, pounding Carew back. âBut only organic compounds are immune to our nuclear bursts, and that would meanâ¦â Stein thinks quickly, âRonald, donât blast it again!â

Too late to stop it, Ronnie has already launched another burst at the robot. It turns its head towards Ronnie as the burst strikes. A green beam of powerful energy flows from its head back at Ronnie! âAaaaahhhh!â he cries out in pain! Stein calls to him, âI tried to warn you: there must be an organic component to that machine - - and itâs feeding our blasts right at us! Weâre helpless! And Belle isâ¦â Ronnieâs not giving up. âNever say helpless,â he says, refocusing, âJust let me clear my head - - and weâll switch tactics from direct to indirect attack!â

Ronnie aims restructuring bursts at the large fluorescent lights above the robot. Instantly, the lights transform into a rain of gooey bubblegum. The sticky mess flows down onto the robot! âCrazy kid, youâve turned those lights into bubblegum!â Carew calls out, stepping near to try and help, calling, âBelleâ¦Iâll get - - get you - - yugggh.â Carew gets covered in gum. Firestorm flies down to help Carew and Belle. âYâknow, there are people whoâd call this a sticky situation,â Ronnie quips, âGood thing Iâm not one of âem.â SPLOK! âWoof!â Ronnie grunts as a robot arm sweeps into his midsection, âIf that gum wasnât slowing him down, that shot wouldâve been a real rib-buster.â He turns to Carew, asking, âYou clear, fella?â Carew squirms away, nodding that Belle is still stuck in the robotâs arm. Firestorm moves to free her, and then flies up with her cradled in his arms.

âGot her,â he announces. âProfessor, any ideas about what we were fighting back there?â he thinks. âA robot containing an organic component, Ronaldâ Stein answers, âItâs out of my field. It sounds like a cyborg.â Ronnie lands safely with Belle. She looks weak and shaken from her ordeal. âHalf-robot, half-human? Like that guy in the Teen Titans?â Ronnie asks, âThatâs not what I felt during the power feedback! That robot was alive. Or something alive was inside it - - and it wanted Belle Haney dead!â Suddenly, a huge radiant burst of light fills the room! Ronnie, surprised, asks âHeyâ¦whatâs happening now?â

From every computer and every monitor in the hall, energy crackles like lightning - - streamers of electricity flowing to the center of the floor, there converging in a single bright column of powerâ¦slowly, fantastically, the column takes on human form! Standing in front of Firestorm, awash in shimmering blue electric light, the human figure stands with arms raised above her head. âI am Byte!â she announces, âBelle Haney must be punished for her crimes. Sheâs hurt too many people. She has to die.â Ronnie tries to negotiate. âI think what we should do here, we should sit down and talk aboutâ¦â ZZZAAAKKKK! Byte dives into Firestorm! âAaaaah!â he exclaims. The impact throws him back, landing several feet away on the floor. âBreathe, Ronald - -try to inhale! You must inhale!â Stein directs. âProfessor, what hit us?â Ronnie asks, momentarily stunned. Stein explains that it was a severe electrical shock. âThat - - creature - - must be pure electricity!â he observes. âYouâre kidding!â Ronnie answers. Stein looks back towards Byte. âNo, Iâm not, and whatâs more,â he warns, âhere she comes again. Stop her!â

âCinch,â Ronnie says, âIâll just use my atomic restructuring powers to zap this console into a catcherâs mitt - - and sheâll - - and sheâllâ¦â ZZAAAAK! Byte passes right through it! âNow where is she?â Ronnie looks around quickly, âIf she can jump from one computer console to another - - like a spark - - how can I find her, let alone fight her?â

Another crackle of energy, this time from the power cables along the floor - - ZZZAAAAK - - and once more, Byte appears. Grinning. âI zapped that light fixture into a vacuum cleaner, Professor, but itâs not even slowing her down! And now sheâs laughing at us!â Ronnie frets. In an instant, Byte disappears into an electrical socket along a wall. âWho is she? Where did she come from? What does she want?â Ronnie asks, snapping his head back and forth to look for her. Byte emerges unseen behind him from another outlet, diving fast to attack. âI told you,â she hisses as she locks her body in a clutch around Firestorm, âI want Belle Haney to die. And youâre in my way!â She sizzles electricity into Firestorm. âYaaaaahhh!â Ronnie cries out in pain. Stein warns that she is electrocuting them! âRonald, break free!â he cries, âBefore out heart stops!â

Ronnie struggles against the surprising power of Byte. He wrestles with her hands that are locked tightly around his shoulder and neck. Her legs are wrapped like a vise grip around his midsection. âFight!â Ronnie says as he struggles. He aims a restructuring burst nearby. âWhat are you doing with that fire hose?â Stein asks, âYou donât dare use it on Byte while sheâs holding us!â Ronnie directs the aim of the fire hose at a circuit breaker box on the wall. âNot - - on - - Byte..â he chokes out. The nozzle on the hose opens wide. SWOOOOOSH! A flood of water pours onto the circuit breaker box. KZZAAAZAAAAAAKKKK! It arcs and sparks as electricity and water react! âYouâve shorted out the entire electrical system for the Coliseum!â Stein exclaims, âNow, I understand. Byte came out of this system - - must be connected to it, somehow! With the system shorting out, sheâll have to escape - - or risk being turned off!â

ZZZAAAKZAAAK! The short circuits continue to sweep through the hall. âDamn you!â Byte yells at Firestorm. Suddenly, she releases him! In a sweeping wave of blue electrical light, she phases into an electric outlet and disappears without a trace! âDear Lord, it worked,â Stein says with relief. âLike I said, cinch,â Ronnie replies, struggling to get back to his feet after the powerful attack.

One by one, the lights come back onâ¦and slowly, a very battered Nuclear Man lifts himself to his feetâ¦ âUnga. Terrific. One of my best stunts - - and no audience. Whereâd everybody go?â Ronnie asks, seeing only Belle and Harry Carew in the hall as he shakily tries to stand. âThey ran - - scared spitless. My nameâs Carew. We met once. You okay?â Carew asks, lending a hand to help Ronnie up. âMe? âBruiseâ is my middle name,â Ronnie replies, âHowâs the lady?â Belle answers that she is a little shaken up but otherwise is fine, thanks to Firestorm. âWhat was that - - Byte creature?â she asks. âIâve got some ideas, but - - Hey! Look at those computer screens!â Ronnie exclaims. âWhat theâ¦?â Carew says, wide-eyed in surprise.

Ten computer monitors in a large wall display suddenly flicker to life with an ominous message. âAttention Belle Haney: Tomorrow at midnight you will die. Tomorrow at midnight you will die,â the screens read. Carew and Belle, still coated in gum residue from the robot, stand with Firestorm in front of the displays. âWhoâs doing this to me? Why? Why?â Belle asks, âIâve never made a real enemy in my lifeâ¦But someone hates me enough to kill me! Itâs insaneâ¦a nightmare!â Firestorm reassures her. âNobody is going to kill you, Ms. Haney. Promise,â Ronnie tells her.

âRonald, you said you had an idea about that Byte creatureâs identity?â Stein asks. Quietly, Ronnie answers. âI do, Professor. But itâs so wild, I canât hardly believe it,â he whispers, âI got a good look at Byte while we were fighting - - and Iâm almost sure - - Byte is Blythe Bonner!â
name: Byte!

description:
Notes:

  • First appearance of the Demolition Team.
  • S.T.A.R. Labs ship is destroyed by the Shark.
  • "Meanwhile..." one page text piece by Mindy Newell.
name: Mind Games!

description: The ultra-humanite (still trapped in limbo) reaches out to take control of the Infinitors. Sending them back to 1942 (which leads into their first appearances in A.S.S) to aid is historical self. All was done as a way for him and his fellow members of the injustice society to escape limbo.
name: Generation pt. 2: A Gauntlet Hurled
Carnival of Doom!

description:
Story 1: Destruction By Design

Brainiac 5 inadvertently destroys the Legion of Super-Heroes headquarters when he tries to cure Danielle Foccart of a strange malady. Unfortunately, with Brainiac 5's methods, he accidentally caused Danielle Foccart to be possessed by the artificial intelligence of Computo. Brainiac 5 is able to save Danielle's life as well as reprogram Computo to be the Legion's servant. Brainiac 5 was also able to create a new Legion headquarters, even better than before.

Story 2: A Shared Destiny

Dawnstar and Wildfire confront their feelings.
name: Destruction By Design

description:
Return of The Dragon Knights, Part One: "Isle of The Kraken" The fate of a world hangs in the balance and only two children can save it!

Moon River In the future, everyone is in fear of... Safari!

The Feral Man: Run For The Shadows Harry Blackburn's on the run from the CIA... poor CIA!

Ekko, Part Two Crimeking is declaring war on Ekko, with New York as the prize.
A bounty hunter named Bedlam pursues Primus and Tigorr on a jungle planet.
name: Confessions

description: The Federation, Klingons, Excalbians and Organians are all mired in the ultimate conflict between good and evil in "Deadly Allies!" Part 4 of 4, continued from the previous issue.
name: Deadly Allies!

description:
1. Cover by Ed Hannigan and Sal Amendola.
  2. "The Power and the People" written by Elliot S. Maggin, penciled by Curt Swan, inked by Dave Hunt, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Albert De Guzman.
name: The Power and the People

description:
"The Judas Contract" part 1 features a day in the life of the Teen Titans! As the teenaged heroes spend a day with loved ones and training at Titans Tower, a secret source records all their actions. Meanwhile, Terra's plans with Deathstroke begin to move forward.

Spoiler

Donna and Kory finish up a photo shoot at Donna's studio. Gar, naturally, is overwhelmed by the skimpiness of Koryâs bathing suit. Tara is present, and asks how Donna could afford such an expansive studio apartment. Donna tells her that it was a gift from Queen Hippolyta. What none of the Titans present realize is that someone is surreptitiously taking surveillance photos of Donna's studio.

Gar and Tara walk Dick back to his midtown apartment. Again, someone continues to take photographs of the group, but none of them seem to be aware of it. After dropping Dick off, Gar and Tara walk over to a nearby frozen pond where Vic Stone and Sarah Simms are ice skating with a group of Sarahâs disabled wards. Vic loses his balance and falls onto the ice, and Sarah and the children begin laughing at them. Vic is only slightly embarrassed, but his humiliation is compounded when Gar turns into a bunny and begins poking fun at him. Afterwards, Vic returns home where he finds a letter from his grandparents. The letter indicates that they will be visiting him some time soon. Vic is not overjoyed to receive such news. As before, someone takes a snapshot of him from outside his apartment.

Later, Gar walks Tara down to the East River. She finally relents to his persistent affections and the two share a kiss. Gar leaves, and Tara takes the raft to Titans Tower. She stops by Raven's room and finds the empath in the midst of meditation. Raven doesn't trust Tara, but as she has been dealing with so many emotional issues as of late, she cannot determine whether her apprehension is justified, or if it is just a by-product of her father Trigon's influence over her.

Some time later, the Titans regroup at the tower and Cyborg goes through a training exercise. He succeeds in overcoming a five-ton steel press. Donna and Kory spar with one another atop a floating raft in the Titansâ swimming pool. Donna has never defeated Kory during these trials and is determined to win. Kory reminds her once again that she was trained by the Warlords of Okaara, and that fighting is second-nature to her. She proves her point by kicking Donna in the jaw, knocking her into the pool. Terra silently watches the various trials, taking note of her potential teammates strengths and weaknesses.

The next training exercise takes place outside. The Titans want to see what Tara is truly capable of and has her spar against Changeling. Changeling, with his usual aplomb, transforms into a variety of animals, and circle about Terra, disrupting her concentration. He keeps making jokes and poking playful fun at her, not realizing that she each barb is steadily bringing her temper to a boil. Finally, Terra can take no more of Gar's shenanigans and unleashes a volley of earth, rocks and debris at him. Volcanic mounds of dirt begin erupting across the island, and the other Titans quickly realize that Terra has lost control. They finally get Terra to calm down, and they make sure that Gar is okay. Cyborg chastises him for provoking her.

Later, Tara retires to the Terminatorâs secret lair. Slade criticizes her for losing control, and tells her that it is only through sheer naivetÃ© that the Titans still trust her. Tara tells him not worry about anything.

Elsewhere, a middle-aged woman and her teenage son monitor Slade and Tara's actions. They take a surveillance photo of them boarding a helicopter. The woman is surprised that she was able to get close enough to Slade to photograph him. She whispers to herself, "Slade, it's been a long time. But not long enough for you".
name: The Judas Contract: Book One - The Eyes of Tara Markov!
Down Time Part Six; A-One And A-Two

description:
Vigilante is mortally wounded and J. J. Davis steals the ambulance he was put in and tries to find the hospital to take care of him. He manages to get him in under an amused name and ditch the stolen ambulance. Meanwhile New York City Police Captain Arthur Hall starts a task force to find and capture the Vigilante.

Also in Westchster county all the crime syndicates are put into a spot where they will be united under one boss. the Controller makes them an offer they can't refuse. There is also a mysterious woman in the group who is putting the gangs together. To find out who she is see the spoiler.

SPOILER WARNING: Click here to reveal hidden content.
Marcia King
name: Memories

deck: The year is 2032. Corruption, prostitution, and cameras are everywhere; from the top of what's left of the American government to the bottom of the sleaziest pit imaginable. When former vid star Reuben Flagg is drafted into the Plexus Rangers, he's sent to Chicago, a cesspool of gang violence, dirty politics and urban warfare. It's enough to crush an ordinary man but Reuben is a survivor and with the help of his new friends, he just might be the man to put it all back together.
description:
January, 2032. Twenty feet of snow has fallen on the Midwest in two months, and the populace of Chicago is dealing with serious stress. Plexus Ranger Chief Reuben Flagg has released a public service announcement assuring citizens that the Plex is doing what is can to provide food and temporary shelter, and he asks for cooperation from the people.

As Reuben and Raul respond to a call about a gunfight at a cattle farm, they discuss the dwindling likelihood that the crashed airliner "Norman Bel Geddes" will be found, or that there are any survivors. Soon, they plow their vehicle into the side of a stable where armed migrants are trying to steal raw beef, and Flagg subdues the thieves.

Afterwards, Flagg and Raul continue to a meeting with the Witnesses, an association of seniors who broker information. Admitting he is unable keep up with Q-USA, the pirate video station he had inherited from his late chief, Hilton Krieger, Flagg proposes a merger between the Witnesses and Q-USA, to which their leader, Harris, agrees. Raul, however, becomes angry with Flagg, feeling he's betrayed Krieger.

Meanwhile, returning from a tryst in the snow-covered woods, Ernesto Klein-Hernandez and Gretchen Holstrom are driving back toward the mall when they come upon a young girl hitchhiking and they pick her up. Before long, they are under fire and being chased by another vehicle. The girl tells them it's her father after them. Gretchen activates a distress beacon, but then plows into a snowbank.

Flagg returns to the PlexMall Ranger station in time to take a call from a fellow Ranger who reports the "Bel Geddes" has been found and that at least one crewman and thirteen passengers, including the mayor's daughter and Ranger-in-training Medea Blitz, were able to walk away. As Flagg orders a helicopter scan over the area, Dr. Titania Weis helps Medea stumble in. Medea then collapses into Flagg's arms, as the racist Weis expresses her disdain toward Medea, and then leaves.

Later, Flagg goes to see Medea in the Mediplex, where she is being visited by her father, Mayor C. K. Blitz, Mandy Krieger, Four World pilot C. G. Marakova and Fourth World head Ester de la Cristo. Medea asks to talk to Flagg alone, and she relates had happened. When the liner crashed, her training kicked in, and she led the survivors out of the area to reach help. They had finally come upon a road and began to follow it. After some hours, a vehicle approached, but the driver apparently intended to ignore the group. Medea had forced the driver, Dr. Weis, to stop at gunpoint and to give the survivors a ride to the Mall.

Medea then tells Flagg about what had happened since he'd last seen her: a fellow agent in Brasilia had arranged therapy for her, which had straightened her out, enabling her to succeed in her Ranger training. She then mentions the attack on the "Bel Geddes", which surprises Flagg, as it was believed the liner went down in a storm. Medea insists they were shot down.

The visit is cut short when Flagg's android deputy, Luther, calls to inform him they've received a distress signal from a point on one of the free roads.

In the woods, a group of thugs in survivalist gear are roughing up Gretchen, while they have Ernesto tied naked to a tree, a noose around his neck. Flagg and Luther arrive in time to prevent Ernesto's murder, and they subdue all but one of the thugs, who gets away in their vehicle. Then, they find the girl sedated in the back seat of Gretchen's car, noting that she has the letters "ASLC" tattooed on her forehead.

Back at the Ranger station, they place the girl in a cell in protective custody. Flagg orders Luther to alter his holographic head to resemble Flagg in order to provide an alibi if needed, while he does some undercover work. He sneaks into de la Cristo's quarters to view the flight recorder data, but finds no useful details. However, while rewinding, he happens to see a prospectus for the sale of Illinois to de la Cristo's company.

The next morning, at the Ranger station, Flagg tries to put the pieces together. He attempts to reach the Plex central office on Mars, but gets only a recording. While Luther puts Raul in the girl's cell to keep her company, de la Cristo calls Flagg to invite him to dinner to discuss her request to visit Chicago. Knowing what he knows, Flagg accepts.

"Dinner" turns out to be de la Cristo, soaking in a tub full of compote. Flagg, against his better judgment, partakes of the concoction, but passes out, as the compote is laced with Somnambutol. De la Cristo then jumps from the tub to set the wheels of her plan in motion.

The next morning, Flagg enters the station where Luther informs him that de la Cristo, Klein-Hernandez and two bodyguards came in at 4 a.m. to requisition a van to drive into the city. Luther shows Flagg the authorization form on which Flagg's signature was forged. When Flagg remarks about an odd smell, Luther runs a chemical analysis which identifies the odor as that of a biological agent used in assassinations. With horror, Flagg rushes to the girl's cell, only to find her dead, and Raul, feeling ill. Feeling righteous anger, Flagg orders Luther to get Raul to a vet, and scan the office for prints. He then throws down his badge and sets off into town.
name: State of the Union! Part 2: Take This Job and Shove It!!
The Wrath of Randarr

description: Sargon returns to her home planet of Umlatek to find that a few things have changed in the 50,000 years since she left. Meanwhile Lugulbanda gets a dire warning that Fen-Ra is about to be attacked. With all of its champions away will the wizards be equal to the challenge?
name: Bid The Past Return!

description: The A-Team is hired to steal the Redbird- a radar-resistant spy plane- by Wild Jack Munroe, a movie star. They travel to a small Caribbean island and infiltrate the army base there in order to steal the heavily-guarded plane. But how can the A-Team steal the plane from under the noses of hundreds of armed soldiers, and what precisely are Wild Jack's plans for such a sophisticated piece of machinery?Â
name: The Flight of the Redbird

description:
Spider-Man returns home from the Beyonderâs World with a new costume! Donât miss out as the web-slinger swings back into his city, alive and happy to be reunited with his family!

This issue marks the first appearance of the venom symbiote suit within the pages of The Amazing Spider-Man. This issue begins with people wondering where all the heroes have gone. Then Spider-Man and Curt Connors come through a portal, followed shortly by the Avengers. Spider-Man then goes about patrolling the city, enjoying the fact that he is finally back home. He also continues to find out what his new costume he got during the Secret Wars can do.

Also, Black Cat tries to find Spider-Man so she can warn him about the Kingpin.
name: Homecoming!

description: With the other Avengers missing in a far-off land, what will happen back home when the Vision appoints himself chairman of the mightiest super-team of all?
name: Chain of Command

description: While out on a routine search for crime, Cap and Nomad are viciously attacked by a familiar face, Dave Cox. Now calling himself the Slayer, a bloodthirsty Dave vows to put an end to Captain America and all who stand beside him!
name: Field Of Vision!

story_arc_credits.name: The Death of the Red Skull

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: The Death of the Red Skull

description: Horatio Piper announces the discover of a new tribe of savages, called the Kinjorges, descendant from Englishes that had been lost in Africa during the17th century. Micah Synn is their leader. The savages make a mess during a dinner and then Micah kisses Foggy's wife Debbie, who kisses him back. Kingpin shows up and says to Micah never mess with someone's woman if he wants to work with him. At the Christmas party at Glorianna's, suddenly Micah and his men enter destroying everything and beating the guests. Daredevil defeat the savages, but outside in the snow, Micah almost kill him when Kingpin knocks Micah out with a punch.
name: Every Good and Perfect Gift

description:
While the rest of the Defenders are relaxing, Iceman, Angel and Beast face-off against The Walrus. However, they have nothing to fear. Frog-Man is on-site to assist them.

After ten years of working their way through all the animals on earth in alphabetical order, and based in a forgotten boiler room, "Uncle Humbert" finally manages to give his nephew Hubert Carpenter the proportional powers of a walrus. He sends Hubert up to create wanton destruction and face the Beast, who is in town for a college lecture, as a test.

Beast is nervous for entirely different reasons: his lecture. Angel and Iceman try to boost his spirits but it doesn't help, especially after Bobby jokingly pretends that Beast is his boyfriend in front of a gaggle of college girls.

Meanwhile Frog-Man, who has his father Leap-Frog's costume, is also coming to the lecture, so he can audition for the Defenders.

Beast manages to overcome his stage-fright and ends up giving a well-received lecture until Frog-Man jumps up on stage. The Defenders, unfortunately, are not interested in a new, untested member, regardless of his appeals.

Back in the Rockies, Moondragon tries to counsel Cloud, but Cloud mentions Angel's interest in her right in front of Candy, sending them both into a huff.

The Walrus rampages ridiculously through town, destroying fire hydrants and fast-food restaurants, until finding his way to Beast's lecture. Angel, Iceman, and Beast try to stop him, but are defeated by his bulging stomach. With an enormous dollop of luck, he manages to knock them all out. Frog-Man then steps in to save the day, beating Walrus through his own luck.

The crowd wants the Defenders to accept Frog-Man into their ranks, but his dad Leap-Frog shows up and drags him home by the ear.
name: If This Be Walrus...!

description: Reprint of previous Doctor Strange material. New cover art by John Byrne and Al Milgrom along with Pin-ups by various artists.
name: What Lurks Beneath the Mask; When Meet the Mystic Minds; If Eternity Should Fall

description:
You can't keep a good ninja down. Learn how Elektra made her way back from the land of the dead and what impact it had on her future and her future with Daredevil!

Includes material from Daredevil #182 and 187-190.
name: Book Four: Resurrection

description:
Reed, alongside other Marvel geniuses, works round the clock to find a solution to Sueâs complicated pregnancy. Alicia recalls Benâs first meeting with the mysterious Karisma.

Alicia relates to She-Hulk about a past experience where The Thing was hypnotized by a villianess named Karisma.
name: Call Her...Karisma!
The Search For Abner Chapter 1: The Grecian Earn

volume.name: The Further Adventures of Indiana Jones

description: Hercules and his friends are summoned by Mentor to Titan, home of the space Eternals. Here the Sun god Apollo lies at death's doorstep. Apollo warns his brother of their father's insanity and the murder of the Olympian gods. But first Hercules must contend with Shreck, a disciple of the mad titan Thanos. Can even the Lion of Olympus stand against a villain who possesses the power of the deceased Captain Marvel's Nega-Bands?
name: Deadly Legacy

description: Tony Stark has to make the most important decision of his life. Meanwhile, Rhodey has returned from his mysterious disappearance with all-new armor!
name: Deliverance

description: In the second story - a young Ka-Zar has his mind controlled by Maa-Gor, who wants the boy to kill Zabu the sabretooth. At the end Ka-Zar escapes from the control and kills Maa-Gor.
name: Escape From New York!

description: Reprints Spider-Man # 25.

Blind Justice! Part 2 of 2. Guest-starring Spider-Man, the Black Widow, and Daredevil. Spider-Man is missing! What has happened to the spectacular one? Regardless, Daredevil and the Black Widow must keep working on the pawnbroker murder case in order to prevent an innocent man from going up the river! The Man Without Fear and Natasha just about have the case solved, when the web-slinger suddenly reappears...in a brand new costume! They'll be glad to have Spidey's help to finish this caper...or will they? Daredevil's deal with the Kingpin may not go over too well with your friendly neighborhood Spider-Man! Cameo appearances by the Kingpin, the Arranger, and Dr. Curt Connors.

Notes: Spider-Man's new costume debuted this month in Amazing Spider-Man 252, Spectacular Spider-Man 90, and this issue.
name: Blind Justice!

description: The pen-ultimate issue!

Marc Spector's dying father repeatedly asks for his son, while his student, Rabbi Davis watches on. Meanwhile, Marlene is practising her acrobatics before finding Marc in a dark room, watching movies of the past he'd rather forget. Just then, he gets a call saying his father is dying. Instead of leaving for the hospital, Marc escapes into his Moon Knight persona, but not before giving Marlene an exposition on who his father was and how Marc turned his back on his ways. Cruising the city with Frenchie, they see a Synagogue burning. Moon Knight enters to save those inside while Frenchie tails the arsonists. Moon Knight then busts in on their hideout and doesn't hold back. Detective Flint's arrival is the only reason he stops. The next morning, Marc and Marlene fly to Chicago, but are too late, arriving just in time for his father's funeral. That night, Marc wants to visit the grave, but runs into a gang of vandals. After taking care of them, they discover that... his father's coffin has been exhumed.
name: Red Sins

description: Rom and Starshine educates the SHIELD military on the horrors of the Dire Wraiths, with the help of Doctor Strange's magic powers. Professional sidekick Rick Jones takes up residence at a hospital to have tests done. However, this house of medicine has also drawn the evil of Wraithkind to its doorstep.
name: Total War, Part 3: The Blood-Trail

description: Black Cat deals with her new powers and Spider-man's dissappearence.
name: Where, Oh Where Has My Spider-Man Gone?

description: Lando goes out to meet an old flame and ends up in the middle of a planetary war!
name: Sweetheart Contract

description:
Last month, the Thing mysteriously disappeared!Â  This month, he doesn't come back!Â  Where is he?Â  What is he doing there?Â  Find out why writer, penciler and inker John Byrne called this one "Further Adventures Of Rocky Grimm, Space Adventurer!"Â  You'll love it!Â 
Â 
NOTE:Â  Originally solicited as "Further Adventures Of Rocky Grimm, Space Adventurer!"
name: Rocky Grimm, Space Ranger (Part 1) Rocky Grimm...Space Ranger!

description: Thor and the viking warrior Eilif battle the fire breathing Fafnir who is destroying the city in search of combat with the god of thunder.
name: If I Should Die Before I Wake...

description:
With the help of Sunfire, the X-Men battle a terrible beast in Japan. Meanwhile, Senator Kelly proposes the Mutant Control Act in Washington.

The X-Men would return from the Secret Wars doing battle in a world called "Battle World" created by the Beyonder. They wouldn't be sent to their home but Tokyo, Japan instead and they didn't come alone. Cyclops was send back to Tahiti, where he was in honeymoon with Madelyne Pryor before the Secret Wars. While in Battle World Lockheed, Kitty Pryde's pet dragon, would befriend and get involved with another dragon similar in size as he. She would follow the X-Men and once on Earth her body would react strangely. She grew to monstrous proportions and in a fit of rage began destroying and razing the city. Sunfire, a one time X-Men, would also help in the conflict. The X-Men would split their efforts; Professor Xavier send Rogue flying back to USA to learn about Kitty, Douglas and the New Mutants. Some would do battle with the she-dragon while the other would try and help the citizens of Tokyo and evacuate the destroyed home. Wolverine would happen upon a house that almost entirely ravaged and on fire. Once he enters he finds a lady mortally wounded under a pile of debris from the collapsed ceiling of her home. He would try to help her as best as he could but realized that there was no saving her. Instead, she made him promise to take her daughter, Akiko, who was there and to take care of her and raise her as she no longer could. Feeling slightly guilty for the dragon's attacks as she came with the X-Men Wolverine would accept. He would take the burden of honor and promise to fulfill the dieing woman wish and took the young Akiko with him. Shortly after the dragon would also be stopped by none other then Lockheed and the X-Men were free to return to America. In the end we see Senator Robert Kelly trying to convince another Senator about the needs of the Mutant Registration Act.
name: Tokyo Story

description:
This fifth issue of Vanguard Illustrates begins a raft of new series and sports a cover by Michael Wm Kaluta.

Story Titles

  • Quark part 2 by Baron and Burchett
  • ...friend in need... by Ron Harris
  • Adventures in Art by Rick Geary
  • Face to Face by Tim Burgard

The original US reprint series from Eagle Comics reprinting the best Judge Dredd stories from UK anthology comic 2000AD.

Due to copyright infringements, parts 11-12 and 17-18 can never be reprinted.

Cover: Brian Bolland (Judge Dredd)

  • Cursed Earth (parts 13-16, 19) (progs 73-76, 79) (Pat Mills (parts 13-16) and John Wagner (part 19) - Mike McMahon)
name: Cursed Earth Part 3

description:
Note: Â This follows events in UncannyÂ  #180.


Illyana had waited till the early hours of the morning to use her spells undisturbed. Â She sent her Astral form to Massachusetts where she found Kitty Pryde had been bound powerless to a chair by the White Queen. Â The White Queen tormented Kitty, showing her Doug Ramsey's telepathically induced fantasy of him dancing with and kissing Kitty. Â Kitty remained defiant, and the White Queen threatened to destroy her mind just as Mastermind her previously done to her. Â As they were arguing about Kitty's potential to join the Hellfire Club, she spotted Illyana's astral form. Â Somehow the White Queen was also able to see Illyana, and used a mind-blast to attack her.

Back at the mansion the New Mutants were woken by Illyana's screams. Â They ran to her aid, but were forced to fight off a hoard of demons. Â The demons all vanished into smoke whenever they were caught, and Psyche used her power to conjure up the image of Illyana as an adult Darkchilde to scare them away. Â The experience left Psyche drained and she hallucinated that the adult Darkchilde carried her back to bed.Â 

Illyana explained to the New Mutants that she was also a demonÂ sorceressÂ and how she had discovered that both Kitty & Doug were being held against their will in Massachusetts. Â The New Mutants were willing to help, but had been left strict instructions to call the Avengers of Fantastic Four in an emergency. Â However, both Roberta the Rceptionist and Jarvis informed Sunspot that their teams were away on missions. Â As the X-Men were also missing in action (see the Secret Wars mini series), so the New Mutants agreed to help. Â None of them could drive and Cannonball couldn't carry the whole team all of the way, so they used Sunspot's money to buy bus tickets to Massachusetts. Â 

At the bus station both Sunspot and Wolfsbane fell into a trance, and went to the observation deck staring out at The Holy Ghost Church, were Cloak & Dagger would go to rest. Â On the bus, Illyana was aware of how Wolfsbane continued to stare at her, while Cannonball & Psyche worried for Sunspot & Wolfsbane. Â They recollected the events of Marvel Team-Up AnnualÂ  # 6, and Psyche revealed that she was worried how a bunch of kids would be able to take on the foes of the X-Men. Â She had attempted to programme the Danger Room for a Hellfire Club scenario, but it refused to let her execute such a high-level sequence. Â While Sunspot and Magma took in the sights along their journey, Cannonball went to talk to Wolfsbane. Â She couldn't accept Illyana because she was a witch, which went against her religious teachings. Â CannonballÂ disputedÂ her beliefs with his own Christian upbringing. Â They compared childhoods, and Wolfsbane told him about how her mother had died in childbirth. Â He consoled her saying that her mother would have loved her, and that she was welcome to join him on a visit back home to Kentucky.

When they arrived in Massachusetts, Magma used her power to burn a Â tunnel into the underground complex at the Academy. Â The New Mutants soon found the spot where Illyana had seen Kitty and rushed to her aid. Â However, the Kitty Prryde they saw tied to the chair was merely a hologram. Â In a flash of blinding lights, the White Queen appeared before them all with a subservient Kitty Pryde. Â She announced that they would all belong heart & soul to the Hellfire Club.
name: Scaredy Cat!

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning
